articles.headline: Wal-Mart’s Good-Citizen Efforts Face a Test
articles.snippet: With controversy building over its role in a Mexican bribery scandal, Wal-Mart’s desire to stay out of the limelight grows.
articles.abstract: With controversy building over its role in a Mexican bribery scandal, Wal-Mart’s desire to stay out of the limelight grows.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Besides its success in selling goods that range from groceries to televisions, Wal-Mart has also shown a highly developed ability to sell itself.

articles.headline: Microsoft Deal Adds to E-Book Battle
articles.snippet: The deal, which gives Microsoft a 17.6 percent stake, values the Nook unit at $1.7 billion — roughly double Barnes & Noble’s entire market value as of last Friday — and bolsters the bookseller’s efforts to make its digital business the linchpin of...
articles.abstract: The deal, which gives Microsoft a 17.6 percent stake, values the Nook unit at $1.7 billion — roughly double Barnes & Noble’s entire market value as of last Friday — and bolsters the bookseller’s efforts to make its digital business the linchpin of its future growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Microsoft agreed to invest hundreds of millions of dollars in Barnes & Noble’s Nook division on Monday, giving the bookstore chain stronger footing in the hotly contested electronic book market and creating an alliance that could intensify the fight over the future of digital reading.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Julie Bosman

articles.headline: New York Pension Funds to Challenge Wal-Mart
articles.snippet: Concerned about Wal-Mart’s reported cover-up of bribery, leaders of New York City’s pension funds said they would vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election.
articles.abstract: Concerned about Wal-Mart’s reported cover-up of bribery, leaders of New York City’s pension funds said they would vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Concerned about Wal-Mart’s reported cover-up of bribery in its Mexico operations, leaders of New York City’s pension funds said Monday they would vote their 4.7 million company shares against five directors standing for re-election to the retailer’s board at its annual shareholder meeting next month.

articles.headline: Data Engineer in Google Case Is Identified
articles.snippet: A former state investigator looking into Google’s Street View has identified the so-called Engineer Doe.
articles.abstract: A former state investigator looking into Google’s Street View has identified the so-called Engineer Doe.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the center of the uproar over a Google project that scooped up personal data from potentially millions of unsuspecting people is the company software engineer who wrote the code.
articles.byline: By Steve Lohr and David Streitfeld

articles.headline: A Tiny Island Is Where Iran Makes a Stand
articles.snippet: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is enjoying a surge of support and nationalism in a feud with the United Arab Emirates over Abu Musa, a four-square-mile spit of sand with about 2,000 inhabitants.
articles.abstract: President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is enjoying a surge of support and nationalism in a feud with the United Arab Emirates over Abu Musa, a four-square-mile spit of sand with about 2,000 inhabitants.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — For Iranians, whose country’s borders have shrunk in the past 200 years after wars and unfavorable deals by corrupt shahs, territorial issues are a delicate matter. So a renewed claim by the United Arab Emirates to the tiny island of Abu Musa in the Persian Gulf has touched a raw nerve.

articles.headline: Ties to Romney ’08 Helped Fuel an Equity Firm
articles.snippet: Tagg Romney, Mitt Romney’s eldest son, and Spencer Zwick, a Romney campaign fund-raiser, turned to wealthy campaign donors for investments in their firm.
articles.abstract: Tagg Romney, Mitt Romney’s eldest son, and Spencer Zwick, a Romney campaign fund-raiser, turned to wealthy campaign donors for investments in their firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a month after Mitt Romney ended his bid for the Republican presidential nomination in February 2008, his eldest son, Tagg, and Spencer Zwick, the campaign’s top fund-raiser, met with a beef company executive who had been a major campaign donor over dinner at the posh Torrey Pines resort in San Diego.
articles.byline: By Michael Luo and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: Panel in Hacking Case Finds Murdoch Unfit as News Titan
articles.snippet: A damning report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch’s British papers convulsed the political and media worlds in Britain and threatens a core asset of News Corporation.
articles.abstract: A damning report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch’s British papers convulsed the political and media worlds in Britain and threatens a core asset of News Corporation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A damning report on the hacking scandal at Rupert Murdoch’s British newspapers concluding that Mr. Murdoch is “not a fit person” to run a huge international company has convulsed Britain’s political and media worlds and threatened a core asset of Mr. Murdoch’s American-based News Corporation.
articles.byline: By John F. Burns and Ravi Somaiya

articles.headline: BlackBerry 10 Prototype Is Given to Developers
articles.snippet: The BlackBerry 10 is critical to the revival of Research in Motion, but early models given to app developers were missing features, like the ability to make calls.
articles.abstract: The BlackBerry 10 is critical to the revival of Research in Motion, but early models given to app developers were missing features, like the ability to make calls.
articles.lead_paragraph: Research in Motion on Tuesday unveiled prototypes of the new BlackBerry phone hardware and software that it hopes will be its salvation. But the company’s demonstrations of the far-from-complete products again raised concerns about its ability to produce final versions on schedule and stay in the fight against Apple and Android phone makers.

articles.headline: Euro Stress Crosses Border Into the Netherlands
articles.snippet: With their economy in recession and facing new belt-tightening measures, the Dutch are showing grim determination.
articles.abstract: With their economy in recession and facing new belt-tightening measures, the Dutch are showing grim determination.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMSTERDAM — Of all the people rocked by the debt and austerity tumult rattling Europe, the famously prudent but prosperous Dutch were seldom on anybody’s watch list. Until now.
